channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-2392] Instable test in flink-yarn-tests
item.description:
The test YARNSessionFIFOITCase fails from time to time on an irregular basis. For example see: https://travis-ci.org/apache/flink/jobs/72019690

Tests run: 12, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 2, Time elapsed: 205.163 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.flink.yarn.YARNSessionFIFOITCase
perJobYarnClusterWithParallelism(org.apache.flink.yarn.YARNSessionFIFOITCase)  Time elapsed: 60.651 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: During the timeout period of 60 seconds the expected string did not show up
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)
	at org.apache.flink.yarn.YarnTestBase.runWithArgs(YarnTestBase.java:478)
	at org.apache.flink.yarn.YARNSessionFIFOITCase.perJobYarnClusterWithParallelism(YARNSessionFIFOITCase.java:435)

Results :
Failed tests: 
  YARNSessionFIFOITCase.perJobYarnClusterWithParallelism:435->YarnTestBase.runWithArgs:478 During the timeout period of 60 seconds the expected string did not show up

Another error case is this (see https://travis-ci.org/mjsax/flink/jobs/77313444)

Tests run: 12, Failures: 3, Errors: 0, Skipped: 2, Time elapsed: 182.008 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.flink.yarn.YARNSessionFIFOITCase
testTaskManagerFailure(org.apache.flink.yarn.YARNSessionFIFOITCase)  Time elapsed: 27.356 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: Found a file /home/travis/build/mjsax/flink/flink-yarn-tests/target/flink-yarn-tests-fifo/flink-yarn-tests-fifo-logDir-nm-0_0/application_1440595422559_0007/container_1440595422559_0007_01_000003/taskmanager.log with a prohibited string: [Exception, Started SelectChannelConnector@0.0.0.0:8081]
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.apache.flink.yarn.YarnTestBase.ensureNoProhibitedStringInLogFiles(YarnTestBase.java:294)
	at org.apache.flink.yarn.YARNSessionFIFOITCase.checkForProhibitedLogContents(YARNSessionFIFOITCase.java:94)

testNonexistingQueue(org.apache.flink.yarn.YARNSessionFIFOITCase)  Time elapsed: 17.421 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: Found a file /home/travis/build/mjsax/flink/flink-yarn-tests/target/flink-yarn-tests-fifo/flink-yarn-tests-fifo-logDir-nm-0_0/application_1440595422559_0007/container_1440595422559_0007_01_000003/taskmanager.log with a prohibited string: [Exception, Started SelectChannelConnector@0.0.0.0:8081]
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.apache.flink.yarn.YarnTestBase.ensureNoProhibitedStringInLogFiles(YarnTestBase.java:294)
	at org.apache.flink.yarn.YARNSessionFIFOITCase.checkForProhibitedLogContents(YARNSessionFIFOITCase.java:94)

testJavaAPI(org.apache.flink.yarn.YARNSessionFIFOITCase)  Time elapsed: 11.984 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: Found a file /home/travis/build/mjsax/flink/flink-yarn-tests/target/flink-yarn-tests-fifo/flink-yarn-tests-fifo-logDir-nm-0_0/application_1440595422559_0007/container_1440595422559_0007_01_000003/taskmanager.log with a prohibited string: [Exception, Started SelectChannelConnector@0.0.0.0:8081]
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.apache.flink.yarn.YarnTestBase.ensureNoProhibitedStringInLogFiles(YarnTestBase.java:294)
	at org.apache.flink.yarn.YARNSessionFIFOITCase.checkForProhibitedLogContents(YARNSessionFIFOITCase.java:94)

Furthermore, this build failed too: https://travis-ci.org/apache/flink/jobs/77313450
(no error, but Travis terminated to due no progress for 300 seconds -> deadlock?)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The same happened to me: https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/72303347/log.txt
Potential cause for the "deadlock" - behavior: https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/2545

I've changed the shutdown behavior of the YARN mini cluster: http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/flink/commit/e45fdf71
I hope this reduces the number of YARN test failures.
Thanks rmetzger, it seems this has also fixed FLINK-1601 .
Observed this failure again. Here's the build log: https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/79502027/log.txt

I observed the failure multiple times again (50 builds). The builds were run with debug log level on travis, thus the logs might be helpful.

This one failed with the following issue: The TaskManager had an OutOfMemory exception:

Something new: https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/81005838/log.txt

No output for 300s
I've observed this one in every build for the last few days.
No output for 300s but this for the testJavaAPI test case: https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/81007000/log.txt

This time it's YARNSessionFIFOITCase.perJobYarnClusterWithParallelism.

https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/81028809/log.txt
This one looks really weird. There are no obvious reasons why the job stops producing output.
Here, I don't have any logs because the run is probably from apache/flink's github
Yes it is. Can we enable it for apache/flink's github account? Would be tremendously helpful.
I agree. I'll set this up soon.
I pushed a commit to resolve this issue: http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/flink/commit/f5476f29
The problem here is that the CliFrontend is not logging the expected string Job execution switched to status FINISHED.. I'm looking into a solution.

Haven't seen this one before: 

Failed tests: 
  YARNSessionFIFOITCase>YarnTestBase.checkClusterEmpty:147 There is at least one application on the cluster is not finished.App application_1442831970261_0006 is in state RUNNING
Tests in error: 
org.apache.flink.yarn.YARNSessionFIFOITCase.testJavaAPI(org.apache.flink.yarn.YARNSessionFIFOITCase)
  Run 1: YARNSessionFIFOITCase.testJavaAPI:642 Â» Runtime Unable to get Cluster status f...
  Run 2: YARNSessionFIFOITCase.checkForProhibitedLogContents:94->YarnTestBase.ensureNoProhibitedStringInLogFiles:294 Found a file /home/travis/build/tillrohrmann/flink/flink-yarn-tests/target/flink-yarn-tests-fifo/flink-yarn-tests-fifo-logDir-nm-0_0/application_1442831970261_0008/container_1442831970261_0008_01_000001/jobmanager-main.log with a prohibited string: [Exception, Started SelectChannelConnector@0.0.0.0:8081]

https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/81355635/log.txt
This is another occurrence of the testJavaAPI test failure, which is fixed in master (pls rebase)

I've set the logging up for apache/flink. Just search the output for download_url= and you'll find the URL.
Note that the upload only works for builds containing commit 4abdbbb1b752537c1206af5010fad9af08106c37
Thanks. That'll prove to be very useful!
I've addressed the issue in this commit: http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/flink/commit/6d1656a2
YARN test get stuck: https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/81436976/log.txt (with logs this time) in YARNSessionFIFOITCase.testNonexistingQueue.

The problem here was that the yarn tests didn't produce output for more than 300 seconds, even though the tests were properly running (logging to a separate file on INFO level).
I've now changed the log4j-travis.properties for the flink-yarn-tests to log every time a test starts and stops. The change is here: http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/flink/commit/64e1dc6f

I've addressed 3 valid cases that can cause the flink-yarn-tests to break the builds. There is a 4. issue that can cause test failures (from this log: https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/81005838/log.txt)
Sadly, I can not really find the issue that caused this build to fail.

I'm leaving this issue open for a few days to see whether there are more YARN tests that need stability improvements.

This fix introduced a new issue

java.util.ConcurrentModificationException: null
	at java.util.ArrayList$Itr.checkForComodification(ArrayList.java:859)
	at java.util.ArrayList$Itr.next(ArrayList.java:831)
	at org.apache.flink.yarn.UtilsTest.getEventContainingString(UtilsTest.java:79)
	at org.apache.flink.yarn.YarnTestBase.runWithArgs(YarnTestBase.java:466)
	at org.apache.flink.yarn.YARNSessionFIFOITCase.perJobYarnCluster(YARNSessionFIFOITCase.java:415)


Results :

Tests in error: 
  YARNSessionFIFOITCase.perJobYarnCluster:415->YarnTestBase.runWithArgs:466 Â» ConcurrentModification

I'm already testing a fix for this issue.

Till asked me in an offline conversation whether we can also upload the logs for pull requests.
We were thinking about uploading logs for builds without S3 credentials to https://transfer.sh/. They are storing the logs for 2 weeks and work with curl.
Fixed in http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/flink/commit/47afdfbf
Would be awesome

Have you seen this one before? Might be related to the recent ResourceManager YARN changes.
Yes. See post above from03/Dec/15
Ok great, then it's probably not due to the recent changes

More instances of failing yarn tests:

https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/137801198/log.txt
https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/137801197/log.txt

The builds fail because the following Exception is logged:

Should be fixed the resolution of FLINK-3962
except it is entirely unrelated to metric names.
What do you mean? The issue is unrelated or the Exception?

the exception is unrelated, that's why i replied directly to the comment regarding the exception and not in the main thread.

Yes, the error message indicates a naming conflict. But this line is generated by us, and is generally accurate since we exclude the possibility of the other case: a non-public interface.
are these jobs from different profiles?
It doesn't matter if it is a naming conflict or a malformed bean. It still seems to be an instance of incorrect registration, no?

Yes it is indeed related to registering metrics. But the issue mentioned so far in FLINK-3962 were related to naming.

I would prefer creating a new issue since the chances of FLINK-3962 randomly fixing this issue as well are slim. They are also only tangentially related based on where they occur, the actual cause (and thus, fix) are most likely completely different.
This issue has been resolved in 7f9580061177e81b8969bb071db0e21d588beda6
Fixed as part of 7f9580061177e81b8969bb071db0e21d588beda6
